reviews.review:
Warning: This review does not contain spoilers.

Bioshock Infinite is very similar to the other games in many respects. Just judging by the official screenshots cycling above, you have the abilites to use special abilites in one hand and a weapon in the other.

In this game, you must rescue a girl that you know next to nothing about. Armed with a pistol and a key, you must wrest her from the clutches of Columbia, a city that would die to protect her and keep her there at all costs.

The game plays very similarly to the other two Bioshock games, but it is less restrictive in terms of combat, and where you can go. Instead of being trapped in an underwater room with dim lights in the corners, you get to zip around on skylines and pick off enemies one by one as Elizabeth follows along and tries not to get shot.

And yes, you get to rescue the girl.

Without revealing too much about the game, the parallels between this one and the other two are crazy and mind-blowing. Everything you'd expect to find in a Bioshock game is here. You just need to look for it.

เนื้อเรื่องเกมส์นี้ถือว่าดีมาก ๆ เนื้อหาในเกมส์มีความเกี่ยวข้องกับประวัติศาสตร์ การเมือง และแนวคิดชาตินิยมอย่างลึกซึ้ง ส่วนเรื่องกราฟฟิกถือว่าทำออกมาได้ดี ทั้งเรื่องฉาก แสงสี เสียง ดูเป็นธรรมชาติ เรื่องอาวุธก็ทำออกมาดี มีการอัพเกรด การเติมกระสุนตามทาง มีระบบสกิล และอัพเกรดได้อีกด้วย

fantastic story! and gorgeous characters!

Not being a big fan of FPS, I was pleasantly surprised at Bioshock Infinite. Gorgeous graphics, fluid combat, good storyline. The plotlines can be interpreted in a few ways which gives it as RPG feel, and the ethical implications of the characters' actions are a really nice touch. Only down side is that it is a tad short, but it's a game definitely worth playing.

[b]Pretty, intriguing, but nothing out of the ordinary, game-play wise.[/b]

You have games such as Battlefield and Crysis that go for hyper-realistic graphics and that's brilliant. I always look forward to the next iteration to see how they can push photo-realism. But then you have games such as The Witcher 2 and Bioshock Infinite that make me think; "Wow, that's beautiful".
We could get into a discussion about artistic direction vs photo-realism and we'd be here all day, but suffice to say, Bioshock Infinite is a beautiful game and I take my hat off to the artists involved.
The story, including those of the DLC Episodes is really quite intriguing, but ONLY if you've played the original Bioshock. Without it, you're missing out on details that truly make this such an interesting game.
For me, the characters within the game were the thing that hooked me in the most. Booker and Elizabeth. A brilliant combination. I haven't played the 'Last of Us' on PS3, but I could quite imagine what has been written on that relationship could also be added here. Voice acting can go so wrong, but not in this game; I applaud the actors here.
Lastly, I reach the gameplay and that for me is where my enthusiasm dips. It's not that it's bad. Far from it; enemies react accordingly. But it's been done before. In Bioshock for instance.
But that's the main game and Episode 1. Episode 2 forces you to play as Elizabeth. And that invokes memories of Thief. Stealth, timing. And it helps to wrap up many of the story threads that have been unresolved.
Do I recommend this game? Yes. I did truly enjoy it. Because ultimately, I was immersed. And that, for video-games is the part I value the most.

Вообще я не большой поклонник шутеров от первого лица. Всегда предпочитал приключения и шутеры от третьего лица (вроде Uncharted и Tomb Raider 2013), поэтому, поддавшись на соблазнительную цену и, купив эту игру, начинал играть в нее с весьма скептическим отношением. И первый час действительно откровенно зевал и скучал - всё казалось таким же как и в других десятках шутеров...

А потом обрывки истории, которые подаются через голософоны и кинетоскопы стали складываться в очень интересную картину. Дальше еще лучше, появляющиеся способности обоих героев открыли простор для тактики, а не просто для обычной стрельбы. Оторвался только через 7 часов от игры!
A bloody good game this is. Excellent visuals, great gameplay and a really good story.

Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt.

-Bioshock Infinite-
One of my personal favorites from 2013, and still is to this day. The reason why this is one of my favorite games of 2013 is because of its immersive plot. The gameplay is basically the same if you played previous Bioshocks, use a vigor and grab a shotgun. There are a diversity of enemies but with the shotgun and bucking bronco, there isnt much of a challenge. The atmosphere and envionment of the game is beautiful, and personally prefer Columbia over Rapture. Booker and Elizabeth has such dynamic character development,and are unforgettable after playing through the entire game. Overall, Bioshock Infinite is a fun and engaging game, though combat can get tediously repetitive, but its managable, the main point of Bioshock Infinite is the beautiful atmosphere and importantly one of the best original stories that came out of 2013.

-Burial at Sea Ep 1-
The First DLC of an amazing game brings us to the city of Rapture, before the downfall. The first half of the game is basically focused on the story, and lets you explore the beautiful city for a bit. The second half is where the usual run and gun combat happens, but with a bit less ammo, so dont be surprised that you ran out. For the cons, the entire DLC storyline can be completed in an hour and a half, didnt even realize that it was that short till I finished it. Overall decent DLC, but if your in it for the story, I will save you $15 and just go watch walkthroughs of Ep 1.

-Burial at Sea Ep 2- 
The Final Chapter of Burial at Sea lets you play Elizabeth from the Infinite Universe just to clear things up, and brings a whole new way to play thanks to the new stealth gameplay. Don't bother playing like Booker, Elizabeth doesn't carry that much ammo and she has less health, and there is no shield this time. The stealth mechanic is refreshing for Bioshock Infinite, though there are times where the AI is really blind as you can sneak in front of them and knock em out. Elizabeth can also crawl through vents and lockpicking is a big focus this time.Story-wise, there will be mind-fu*ks, like Infinites story,but as you progress,one major plot point made me dissapointed that I would not say, and is best for you to experience yourself. Overall Episode 2 is really fun and a fresh experience and actually worth the $15 in my opinion, compared to Episode 1.

I would also recommend that you play the first Bioshock before you play this game or at least before you play either of the Burial at Sea DLCs since it makes more sense. This game is also much more than just a simple fps, so don't treat it like you would the campaign of Call of Duty. You need to understand what's going on around you to become fully immersed in the game or else you will completely miss out on a great game and a great experience. So would you kindly take my advice... If you don't get that, go play Bioshock first, which is also a good game especially for such an old game.

Extremely disappointing, considering the effusive praise it got (and continues to get) post-release.

There is no atmosphere to speak of because Infinite lacks consistency. The original Bioshock created tension through dark, creepy visuals and a sense of despairing, late-to-the-party decrepitude. Infinite switches from colourful and friendly to sinister on the turn of a dime, which is a pity, because the idea of a floating, neo-confederate new Eden held a lot of promise.

The gameplay is mediocre. Combat is bland and extremely easy on normal, while Vigors are generally unnecessary. AI is also fairly poor for such a modern game; there is a difference between zealotry and idiocy, and baton toting policemen climbing over their dead comrades to get into my crosshairs is in the latter category. Incidentally, the rave reviews that Elizabeth received are nonsensical - she deigns to gives you money and ammunition occasionally and is otherwise untargetable during battle. That's it. 

Visuals are good, yes, but there could have been so much more. Most buildings cannot be explored and progression is almost purely linear, unless you plan on backtracking exactly the way you came to open a missed chest or a locked door. As for the Skyhook mechanic... well, it's there. You can use it in combat if you like, but it's not very efficient unless the game decides that it's mandatory.

As for the plot, well, I don't know if I can stand the gameplay long enough to finish the damn thing. The dialogue isn't that great, so I doubt I'm going to be wowed by however the alternate-universe plot-majig is explained. Yahtzee did like this game, but nobody is perfect.

Bioshock Infinite completely renewed my faith in Single Player games after taking a long hiatus from them. From the depth of the storyline to the gameplay, the game is really fantastic. I really enjoyed the interplay between Booker and Elizabeth during combat as well as the money system and how you don't really die and have to start over. I have yet too see what another pass through the campaign is like so I can't say much to its replay value. But the only thing I was a tiny bit disappointed with was that I was a little confused in the end, it took a little twist into the really weird instead of just being a little far fetched. BUT, overall AMAZING game, great story, great gameplay, took me a total of about 12 hrs of gameplay to get through it all on medium difficulty attaining 34 of the 80 achievements. Granted, I haven't played the 2 DLC's but I will be very soon. All in all, get this game!

Всегда скептически относился к франшизе BIOSHOCK. Даже вплоть до выхода этой игры. 
Играл я в нее, даже не пройдя ни одну из предыдущих частей, и вообще не захватило меня ни сюжетом, ни геймплеем, ни сетингом, в общем, вообще ничем.
Однако, что-то меня заставило поиграть в нее снова, и тут я понял, что в ней практически все идеально :)
Мир, открытый мир при линейном сюжете, в котором, как ни странно, чувствуешь себя свободно. Постоянные бои, но зрелищность их перекрывает факт того, что они происходят почти каждые пять минут. Прокачка оружия, по статам, крайне невелика, но в бою существенно ощущается. 
По поводу сюжета - я начитался спойлеров перед прохождением, но после того, как я прошел игру, у меня было ощущение, что я их и не читал :)
Я не жалею, что не прошел предыдущие части, но знаю о них достаточно для того, чтобы понимать, о чем вообще идет речь в данной части франшизы. Хоть они практически и не связаны между собой.
Очень рад, что в нее поиграл, времени, потраченного на нее я не жалею. Теперь коплю на DLC :)

Bioshock Infinitie is a fantastic game. The game looks beautiful and is oozing with detail. The story is also amazing, keeping you hooked from beggining to end, with a huge, mind blowing finale. Overall, this is one of the best games I have ever played. It is a must buy. Bioshock Infinite gets a deserved 10 out of 10.

Wow what a game... where should i start?

Story was absolutely pure gold and it was one of the best what i have ever played. Okay, i need to admit that ending was a little bit disappointing to me but it was fine for me at the end.

Gameplay was pretty normal like in other shooter games. Shoot and run system with some magical skills and tactical defense system. But gameplay was made pretty nicely so it was awesome still to play. Weapons were fun and easy to play.

Design and artwork is one of the best what i have seen in my gaming life. Style how the graphics were made was so detailed and floating islands with unique people and wonderful soundtrack nailed for me!

Game had stuff to collect and they were challenging to find but it was always rewarding to find them.

Graphics are stunning, so you cant play this with old school computer. I played with low end laptop with 1280x720 resolution with medium graphics... but it was still beautiful and awesome to play!

Summary: Storybased game with good gameplay and stunning graphics, must buy to people who loves to play and watch good stories.

8.5/10!

To everyone opting to play Bioshock Infinite: I strongly recommend playing the Bioshock 1 before even starting Bioshock Infinite.

Regarding Bioshock Infinte (without spoilers): 
I recommend this game - it's a totally awesome experience, very atmospheric, featuring unique gameplay ideas, very believable characters, strong and mind blowing plot and beautiful visual design. Bioshock Infinite is one of the best action games of the last years. 

Rating it 10/10.

But, at the same time it's a sad game. 
A drama. 
A tragedy. 

You might ask - what makes the game so damn tragic? 
The answer is - the Bioshock Infinite DLCs "Burial at Sea".

Having played Bioshock series in the right order (Bioshock 1 - Bioshock 2 - Bioshock Infinite), I enjoyed the whole series immensly.  
The  Bishock Infinite DLCs complete the story of the series, but  the story arc unfolds in such way,  that now I wish only to forget what I saw while playing "Burial at Sea", and even the whole Bioshock Series is now a one whole drama to me. 

Some secrets better be left untold, some parts of the story better be buried and never known. 

You will not find hope here. 
You'll not find your dreams here. 
It's like watching "The Bridge to Terabithia" again.
I have never played such a depressing game in my whole life -_-

Об этой игре можно сказать только хорошее. И оно уже все сказано. С удовольствием прохожу второй раз и игра постоянно радует и динамичностью и атмосферой. 
 Вот уж не знаю как другим, но для меня концовка была логичной, понятной и не взорвала мозг. Самое лучшее, что получилось у разработчиков- это создать особенную и неповторимую атмосферу.
 А Элизабет? В эту тян не возможно не влюбиться или, в крайнем случае, не испытать симпатию. Милая, эмоциональная, очень часто помогвет в тот момент, когда это действительно необходимо. А ещё она дает тебе деньги (вот тут у меня произошел небольшой разрыв шаблона).
 Но вернемся к самой игре. Добавлено много динамичности и большой выбор оружия. Правда носить с собой можно только два вида. Энергетики выбираются по вкусу и стилю прохождения. Ну я отмечу ещё красивые пейзажи которые можно долго разглядывать.

Печальный хэппи-энд трилогии "Bioshock".

А именно так можно охарактеризовать финал последнего сюжетного DLC "BioShock Infinite: Burial At Sea Episode 2", завершающего всю линейку игр серии "Bioshock", и скажу вам, завершающего просто превосходно! И вправду, на этот раз никаких вопросов, пришло время ответов, и все эти долгожданные ответы прямо таки вываливаются на головы игроков. С самого начала и до самого конца "Burial At Sea Episode 2" не дает заскучать и держит в напряжении до самого конца!

Не имеет смысла вдаваться в разглагольства про все новшества и нововведения, ибо в трейлерах и анонсах и так все сказали и показали, да и сыроваты они оказались. Стелс более походит на нелепую игру в прятки. Но опять таки, на фоне сюжета и атмосферы все, подчеркну, ВСЕ минусы меркнут.

Впервые мы видим абсолютно всех персонажей в одной игре, связанных единой историей. Именно в этой части все пазлы собираются воедино, рисуя полноценную, увлекательную и чертовски необычную историю "Bioshock", подводя жирную черту под всем вышесказанным. Финал, как это уже повелось у всей серии, просто великолепен (эпичность со вкусом скупой слезинки прилагается), заставляет совершенно иначе посмотреть на первую часть серии и вызывает острое желание вновь вкусить оригинальный "Bioshock" . Безусловно, вся трилогия поистине удивительное явление в игровой индустрии, являющееся эталоном того, КАК нужно составлять сюжетную линию. 

Стоит ли ждать продолжения? Нет, да и зачем? История полностью закончена и закончена она на высшем уровне! Хоть и нехотя, но пришло время попрощаться с Джеком, Букером и Элизабет. Попрощаться. но не забыть славную троицу.
Просто нет слов, главная героиня ведет себя как живая, а сюжет наверно один из самых лучших из игр выпущенных за последнее десятилетие
Probably the best story of all the games I've played. Also amazing gameplay, love it.

This game is phenomanal.  I love the fact that its actually playable on an older computer with a slightly upgraded video card.  I loved the whole series, except part 2 was a bit lame.  Highly recommend this game!

I ate two potatoes out of a toilet.

10/10!
Eye candy with truely smart and complex story!

Шутан с убогим управлением. Меняй раскладку под себя и жди, что какая-нибудь сцена окажется непроходимой, просто потому, что игра не ожидала, что "лупить крюком" можно будет аж на две кнопки назначить.

Баги ещё есть. Развлекайтесь бесконечным просмотром внимации открывающихся дверей. А последний чекпоинт был около 20 минут назад, ему не очень интересно было, что все это время было потрачено на зачистку локации. Быстрое сохранение? Небритый пекарь, узри мощь консольного геймплея!

И нет, Лиза не может ударить в парении ногами в лицо дуралея на земле. И подвесить на [strike]горгулью[/strike] крюк никого не может.

Зато история и картинка просто замечательные.

Терпите теперь.

Прошел уже второй раз,благо вышло финальное DLC.Вначале спиратил этот шедевр,но как только добрался до финала,понял-это обязательно войдет в мою коллекцию.Трудно назвать это произведение игрой-это целый мир,полный невероятных открытий,наполненный драмой,сочетающей в себе счастье и любовь,не лишенной нотки юмора.один только момент первой встречи с Лиз вызывает неудержимый смех.И хоть окончилась эта история ой как болезненно,все равно остается вера,что долг будет уплачен,и девчонка будет возвращена.
Really nice storyline!
The best story in a game there has EVER been.

Я играю с 2004 года, мной пройдено не менее сотни игр. Серия Bioshock является для меня самой лучшей из всех, что я когда-либо играл. Bioshock - очень хороший сюжет, великолепная детализация персонажей и мира, увлекательный геймплей, позволяющий возвращаться в Восторг вновь и вновь. Bioshock 2 - модернизированный геймплей , разнообразие противников, интересные персонажи, грандиозное окончание дней Восторга. Bioshock infinite - к сожалению, менее увлекательный игровой процесс, с лихвой компенсирующийся великолепным, "крышеснощим" сюжетом, изумительная детализация мира. Дополнения - достойны самой изысканой похвалы. Это гениально, действительно сделано с душой, и это не просто слова.
Geil, schlechthin.

A bon FPS de l'anné 2013 des bon graphisme.
C'est la suitee de "Bioshock"
Un peu dommage que le jeux soit pas en multi mais c'est pas grave
It may not be the greatest game the hype makes it out to be, it's still worth playing and does just about everything right. Hard to beat when a sale makes it less than $10.
ШЕДЕВРАЛЬНО.

It is with a heavy heart today that I uninstall Bioshock Infinite from my PC after just over a year in service. This is not something I've looked forward to, but the day was always due to come. However, my experience with the game has finally drawn to a close no matter how much I wish my time in Columbia could go on.

Like countless others, I preordered the game last year. Unlike many, I was not the biggest fan of the first two Bioshock games (they were okay, though the setting didn't connect with me). From the available information, I could tell Infinite would be different. I was not disappointed. 

I know the game has taken a lot of flak from critics, particularly in the time since initial release, but I wholeheartedly recommend the game to anyone who feels even the slightest interest in the game. In the year I've had to enjoy Bioshock Infinite, Steam tells me I've logged 58.5 hours. In that time, I've run through the main game at least three times, toyed with the Clash in the Clouds DLC for a bit, ran through each of the story DLCs a couple times, and chased all but a few pesky achievements. People can bash the gameplay or the plot all they want, but I enjoyed all of it. I'm greatly saddened in the likelihood I'll never explore Columbia again, except for when I inevitably replay the main game in a few years time.

The things I've loved most about my experience have been the setting and the story. The setting of Columbia, as I previously mentioned, resonates with me in a much deeper way than Rapture ever did. The art style and the color palette are gorgeous. The world-building lore was intriguing, and it made me want to explore every nook and cranny to soak up the vibe and get to know the city. The story has been widely criticized, but I personally have not been so affected by a AAA game or reallly any FPS, indie or otherwise, in years. This boils down to the Booker/Elizabeth relationship. They were both great characters and the ending of the main game (and to a lesser extent, the DLC) actually elicited an emotional response. 

All good things come to an end and in spite of the game's title, I knew I couldn't infinitely experience fresh things in this game. I'm sorry to see Irrational close its doors, but I feel this is a respectable note to end on. I look forward to one day playing through with fresh eyes again. I'm sure it will hold up for me. 

Do yourself a favor and buy this game.
